The robots can be programmed in the programming tab. In the case of conceptual layouts, the robots can utilize robot controllers to automatically perform tasks. All the robots have a similar component structure and therefore they mostly support same features and they are easily replaceable with each other.
### How to use – Program tab ### Move the robot with the “Jog” tool and create the motion statements in the “Program Editor”. The created statements will have configurable properties as well. For grasping/releasing products, changing tools, and other actions., see the “Signal Actions” and “Actions Configurations” properties for further customization.
### How to use – Robot Controller ### Robot controllers, such as, “Process Modeling Robot Controller” component can be used to automate robot programming. See our academy lessons for further instructions.
### How to use – OLP ### We provide post-processors and pre-processors for continuously expanding group of robot vendors in our forum. In addition, we have some advanced robot statements available in the forum.
### Key Properties ### Executor::IsEnabled = Determines if the robot is turned ON / OFF Executor::IsLooping = Determines if the robot program is looped when the program is run in programming tab
